definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: The candle flames danced madly in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 烛火在风中疯狂的舞蹈。

sentences.english: A darkling fire, faint hovering o'er a tomb.
sentences.chinese: 爱情只是那一小团悬浮在坟墓上的烛火。

sentences.english: The light from the flickering candle was dim.
Your candle burned out long before.
You think that the candle, even out but once shined.
sentences.chinese: 你想像那烛火，就算熄灭但曾经闪耀过。

sentences.english: We lived for the night. The torch in your window was my signal.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚我们醒了过来，你窗前的烛火是给我的信号。

sentences.english: There are millions of people lighting candles of hope in our world today.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们的世界，成百上千万的人点燃希望的烛火。

definition: candle light/candle-lit (vigil etc)/candela, unit of luminous intensity (cd)
fire and candles/household things that burn
red candle (used during birthdays and other celebrations)
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
altar lamp burning day and night
drop of melted wax that runs down the side of a candle
a glimmer/twinkling (of stars, phosphorescence, candlelight)/flickering light
